Glass doesn't understand... until Spotted Horse points to ROW OF BUFFALO HIDES hanging from a line.
Spotted Horse (cont'd) We trade Bra-zo.
Glass stares at the tanning hides, then down at his leg. Finally, he nods. Spotted Horse starts walking... waves f Glass to follow.
Spotted Horse (cont'd) Come. Eat.
Glass follows after him. The children sneak in behind, giggling as they tail Glass across camp.
Glass glances back... New Moon and Little One duck behind tee-pee... wait for him to continue before they scoot bac out after him. 64.
Glass, Spotted Horse, Three Feathers, Running Fox and OTH WARRIORS sit around a fire, eating with CHIEF RED HAWK, t Medicine Man, and several other TRIBAL ELDERS.
The men stole my rifle.
The Sioux don't understand. Glass reaches over, taking Spotted Horse's plate.
They took. They took...
Glass aims an imaginary rifle.
...my rifle. My gear.
Now Spotted Horse understands... translates for the other
They left me to die. So I mean to find `em both. Get my rifle back.
Spotted Horse translates again. Red Hawk nods, studying Glass.
Red Hawk SAYS SOMETHING to Glass... motions to the BEAR C NECKLACE. Glass looks to Spotted Horse.
Red Hawk ask who kill griz-lee.
Glass touches his chest. Red Hawk nods, impressed. Glass points to the JAGGED SCARS running up Red Hawk's neck to MISSING RIGHT EAR.
Grizzly?
Red Hawk smiles... shakes his head.
Arikara.
That word, Glass understands. Red Hawk rambles a long sentence in Sioux. The other members LAUGH. 65.
He say Arikara take right ear of Sioux. Left ear of whites. Not know what they take from you.
Glass smiles along with the others. They continue their m
Snow falls over Glass, as he stands outside the tee-pee, flexing his injured leg... putting more weight on it... testing its recovered strength.
Suddenly, a SPEAR PLANTS INTO THE GROUND BETWEEN HIS FEET Glass turns, startled... sees Spotted Horse, Three Feathe Running Fox, and several OTHER WARRIORS staring at him.
Glass' eyes jump from the spear to the warriors, unsure.
Spotted Horse strides to Glass... grabs the spear, then s it sideways... stares at Glass, until a smile spreads acr Spotted Horse's face... he holds the spear out to Glass.
Buff-A-lo Man hunt with Sioux?
Glass relaxes... nods... takes the spear from Spotted Hor Three Feathers hands a BUFFALO HIDE to Glass... motions f Glass to put it on.
Tatanka Wicasa.
Glass wraps the hide around him. The Warriors smile and n

A world of silent white... like we're inside a giant snow globe. The sky is emptying all the snow it has over us... pouring down... the only sound comes from the flakes hitt the already fallen snow. The pale trunks of Cottonwoods r up from the white ground.

Then out of the white... a SHAPE APPEARS... a GIANT WOLF WALKING ON ITS HIND LEGS. But as the wolf comes closer, w see it's not a wolf at all... it's THREE FEATHERS, wearin his WOLF SKIN. He CRIES OUT... HOWLING WILDLY.
A few yards beside him, another WARRIOR is doing the same CHANTING... beating his spear against the Cottonwoods as walks. 66.
...walking slowly through the trees, carrying the spear. Yellow Bear is beside him... motions for Glass to spread
...we see the fur-covered warriors are formed into a wide circle... and slowly converging... YELLING... pounding th spears... making as much noise as possible, as they tight their ring.

...watching DISTANT CHANTING WARRIORS pushing through the trees. V.O. SNORTING... our POV darts sideways... charges through the brush... slides to a stop when we see Running moving toward us... spins back another direction.
...the falling snow clinging to his face... covering the buffalo hide.

And then a MASSIVE SHAPE BLASTS through the trees ahead o him. Glass freezes, his grip tightening on the spear. He looks to Spotted Horse, who nods... YELLS OUT, beating hi spear against the trees, and motioning for Glass to do th same.

Glass is apprehensive at first... just lightly tapping hi spear. But as the other warriors' chants grow, Glass gets caught up in the hunt... begins beating the trees... YELL as loud as his throat will allow.
...to Spotted Horse waving his spear... back over the sno to Three Feathers SCREAMING... we spin again... crash thr bushes, then suddenly TUMBLE... DROP THROUGH THE SNOW. 67.
...seeing Spotted Horse pick up his pace... start trottin forward. Glass does the same... all the hunters convergin around a LARGE BLACK HOLE IN THE SNOW...
...and the ELK trapped at the bottom.
The warriors cry out victoriously... begin DRIVING THEIR SPEARS INTO THE TRAP, killing the animal.
The elk roasts over a fire at the center of the village. Glass sits alone outside the tee-pee, using the sharp tip the spear to carve into a small chunk of wood.

As he carves, New Moon and Little One sneak around the te pee behind him... watch Glass work. Glass hears them GIGGLING... doesn't react... just keeps carving... tilts long handle of the spear as he works, tapping the side of tee-pee, and SHAKING LOOSE A CLUMP OF SNOW DOWN ONTO THE BOYS.

The shocked boys freeze in the cold... wipe the snow from their faces to see Glass grinning at them. The little boy charge Glass, leaping onto him... wrestling him to the ground, as they squeeze his hair.
Tatanka Wicasa! Tatanka Wicasa!
Spotted Horse stands across the village, watching Glass a the boys play in the snow.

Glass stands at the edge of the village, carving at the w with the spear tip, and watching the Sioux from a distanc Yellow Bear sees him... approaches, carrying his SON on h shoulders. The little boy gnaws on a strip of meat.
Spotted Horse holds out a bowl of food to Glass.
Thank you.
Good hunt. 68.
Yes.
Glass smiles up at Spotted Horse's son.
You. Fam-i-lee?
(shakes his head) No.
No wom-an? (pointing to son) Wakayaja?
A long beat, then...
No. Not for a long time.
Glass continues eating... watches Spotted Horse bounce th giggling little boy on his shoulders.
Glass steps out of his tee-pee, whittling with the spear He glances up... freezes because he sees several Sioux pulling the hides from the line... rolling them up to car
Spotted Horse (O.S.) Bra-zo.
Glass turns to Spotted Horse, pointing to the hides. Glas nods... looks back to the last of the hides being pulled down... doesn't seem as excited as he once might have bee
Spotted Horse and Three Feathers sit atop their horses. Three Feathers holds the reins to another horse packed wi hides. An empty horse stands beside them... waiting for Glass.
Glass is leaning over to New Moon and Little One... handi them the CRUDE BUFFALO CARVING he made from the wood.
(taps his chest) Tatanka Wicasa. 69.
The little boys smile. Glass nods to Waki, then waves to Hawk and the Medicine Man. They return it... watch Glass climb onto his horse.
Glass, Spotted Horse and Three Feathers ride out of the village.
Glass, Spotted Horse and Three Feathers ride along a high ridge, surrounded by empty snow-covered wilderness. They have the world to themselves.

Glass crouches over a shallow, five-foot long hole surrou by deep snow. The hole is filled with small fires and roc And he's watching Spotted Horse and Three Feathers tossin rocks into their own matching holes, then dragging the di back into them. Spotted Horse throws a glance back to Gla making sure he understands.

Glass nods... pulls the dirt back in, covering the flames He watches Spotted Horse spread a blanket over the warm ground, then does the same. He sits on the mound of dirt. leans back against a tree... feels the warmth rise up fro beneath him.
He nods to Spotted Horse, who is already resting under hi blanket.
Nice.
Nice.
Glass pulls the buffalo hide around himself... keeping wa
SPOTTED HORSE (cont'd) Sleep. No Arikara.
Glass nods... but still doesn't close his eyes. Spotted Horse tosses his knife over beside Glass. Glass takes it. nods to Spotted Horse.
SPOTTED HORSE (cont'd) Me sleep. 70.
Spotted Horse rolls over, turning his back on Glass... trusting him with the knife. Three Feathers does the same
Glass just stares out into the night.
Dark and quiet... except for the SNORING of a few men. Fitzgerald sleeps on his cot. A shadow glides across him. hovers over his face.
Fitzgerald's eyes blink open.
...on GLASS STANDING OVER HIM... his scarred face calm an deadly... raising a knife to drive down into Fitzgerald's chest.
No... please.
But Glass swings the blade.

And Spotted Horse shaking Glass awake from his dream. Gla hand flies up, the knife gripped. But Spotted Horse grabs his arm... stops it in mid-swing... holds it until Glass realizes it was a dream... relaxes.
We go.
Glass calms... nods.
Just a small cluster of log buildings sitting along the b of the Missouri. Dozens of tee-pees and tents are set up outside the complex.
Glass follows Spotted Horse and Three Feathers into the c BEGGING INDIANS and DRUNK TRAPPERS paw at the men as they ride past, pleading for handouts. 71.
One of the Indians grabs for the hides. Three Feathers plants his foot in the Indian's chest... shoves him back the snow.
They continue on... climb off their horses outside the TRADING POST. Three Feathers stays to guard the hides, as Spotted Horse and Glass enter.

A small, dingy room lined with shelves, all stacked high pots, pans, dry goods, whiskey, blankets, weapons... anyt that can be traded. KIOWA BRAZEAU, (60's), French-Canadia stands behind the counter... looks up when the BELL over door RINGS... sees Spotted Horse with Glass behind.
(thick French accent) Bon jour, Spotted Horse. You come with many hides I hope. (off Spotted Horse's nod) We make good trades then.
Brazeau's eyes lock on Glass... stares at him, unsure.
Monsieur Glass?
Good to see you again, Mr. Brazeau.
Jesus Christ, what happened to your goddamned face?
Had a tussle with a grizzly.
Glass shakes Brazeau's hand. Brazeau studies his face... notices the Bear Claw Necklace... smiles.
And now the grizzly, he don't look so good either, eh?
